text: Pseudoxyptilus is a genus of moths in the family Pterophoridae containing only one species, Pseudoxyptilus secutor, which is known from South Africa. The wingspan is 17–19 mm. The forewings are brownish white and the hindwings are light brown. ==Etymology== The generic name reflects the superficial similarity of this genus to Oxyptilus. ==References== Category:Oxyptilini Category:Moths of Africa Category:Monotypic moth genera Category:Moths described in 1911
title: Pseudoxyptilus
